summary: The China Military Power Transparency Act of 2025 amends the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2000 to extend and modify the requirements for an annual report on military and security developments involving the People's Republic of China. It extends the reporting deadline to January 31, 2030, and expands the scope to include topics like nuclear and drone cooperation, foreign farmland acquisitions, cyber capabilities in conflict, biotechnology, and the strategic intent of the People's Liberation Army regarding Taiwan and cyber warfare.
